overview: From 2025-10-24 to 2025-10-25, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 11 new PRs (9 merged), 1 new issues, and 33 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] Add DA footprint block metric
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body: Similarly to how we added a base fee block metric.

topIssues.title: Add finalization configurability
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body:
When running L3s, the hard-coded finalization parameters at 
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/cb54822c5e18925498f48d8677b71992bf402631/op-node/rollup/finality/finalizer.go?plain=1#L18-L35
don't work well. L2s usually have a block time of 2s, so a sixth of Ethereum's target block time of 12s.

We could make those constants optionally configurable, or even better make the L1 block time optionally configurable and then adjust these constants accordingly, similar to how the finality loopback is already calculated differently for AltDA chains at
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/cb54822c5e18925498f48d8677b71992bf402631/op-node/rollup/finality/finalizer.go?plain=1#L37-L50

We could then also auto-detect at startup if a `L1ChainID` is known in the embedded superchain-registry and then load the block time automatically. This way, L3s using e.g. Base or OPM would just work out of the box without additional configuration.

In a next step we may even consider adding an optional `L1BlockTime` to the rollup config.

topPRs.title: Enable monitoring in sysgo
topPRs.author: op-will
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
Adds L2 observability to op-devstack, wiring it up for kona-node.

Note: observability still needs to be wired up for op-reth and other L2 components that expose metrics, but this PR provides a pattern to use to do that.

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

**Tests**
Added tests for utils that were added in this PR as well as a test that confirms that the option returned from `WithL2MetricsDashboard` works in the default case (does not fail when being applied).

<!--
Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.
-->

**Additional context**
The new `WithL2MetricsDashboard` option factory function configures and starts dockerized prometheus and grafana instances to expose metrics if any component has registered metrics endpoints with the `Orchestrator`.

Note: This functionality is disabled by default. If enabled docker is required to be installed, and the `SYSGO_DOCKER_EXEC_PATH` should be set to the docker binary.

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

**Metadata**
- Closes #17941 
<!-- 
Include a link to any github issues that this may close in the following form:
- Fixes #[Link to Issue]
-->

topPRs.title: SaferSafes: Fix version checks
topPRs.author: alcueca
topPRs.body:
Fixed the version check in TimelockGuard to be >=1.3.0 && <1.5.0, with reasons in the comments.

Added a version check for LivenessModule2 to be >=1.3.0 && <1.6.0, with reasons in the comments.

topPRs.title: GasPriceOracle: remove saturating math from getOperatorFee (jovian)
topPRs.author: geoknee
topPRs.body: This cherry picks #17913 (already merged to develop) onto the release branch for `op-contracts/v5.0.0` so we can cut a new RC.

topPRs.title: chore: Stabilize & simplify docker build
topPRs.author: janjakubnanista
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

- Introduces a new `builder_foundry` build stage (built on `$TARGETPLATFORM` as opposed to `$BUILDPLATFORM`) that downloads `forge`, checks the checksum and outputs the version. Forge version could not have been checked when running this on `$BUILDPLATFORM`
- Bumps the `builder` stage image to `alpine:3.21` so that we can install the exact same `just` as we have in `mise.toml`. This in turn means we don't need to use `mise` to install it which in turn means more stable builds
- Replaces string-concatenation JSON building in `forge-checksums.sh` with a `jq`-based script

**Notes**

- Although `foundryup` is a much simpler way of installing `forge`, it would mean updating the mechanism with which we compute checksums. `curl`-based download has been preserved not to touch the `op-deployer` codebase

topPRs.title: feat: use a nonce for timelock configuration
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Puts timelock configuration behind a nonce, which allows us to clear the timelock configuration with an O(1) operation.

* TestImplementations: remove parallelism to reduce likelihood of resource contention
* cli_runner: poll anvil env to ensure its ready before called
